alert.note: Alert for Portage (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:00PM EST until February 21 at 5:24AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Mahoning and Portage. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 959 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Youngstown, Ravenna, Boardman, Kent, Alliance, Tallmadge, Streetsboro, Campbell, Canfield, Sebring, Mogadore, Austintown, Struthers, Brimfield, Randolph, Atwater, Edinburg, Poland, Ellsworth and Windham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
